75V-NLZKDaREfgIXctI9bA.text: Don't, just don't !! Raising customer indifference to a whole new level with cooking and presentation to match

CKxXGS5J9WzX7cOxLg_IQA.text: Rude waiters and tiny portions! Maybe if the food was great it would make up for it but it was hardly mediocre. Many great Indian restaurants nearby, don't go for this one

QdPZdrmGFRgFxOzIuJIaEg.text: Simply delicious! You have to try the Saag Paneer, Saag Daal and Lamb Balti. The butterfly prawn is amazing and prawn pury is surprising (shrimp curry on a pancake). Great service and atmosphere and very reasonable prices. Pleasure.

uSqWabOHoQh8FKJDCcZMkQ.text: Absolutely wonderful place for Indian near Kensington Garden. They were very attentive to our diet restrictions and made is feel very welcome. If you have GFCFSF needs in London and need an Indian fix, this is the spot!

E4TTXrOuwrQKOMjcl-x9IA.text: This place is the real deal...good quality ingredients, super fresh, tasty curry with excellent service.

jMttbJrXDCS-YGjB77-ewA.text: Taste of India special was very good. The butter chicken a little bland but still good. Probably one of the Better Indian restaurants In bayswater

qHt-pcugihJtjhXjHd22AQ.text: The food was quite good. Disappointment always follows when you want something spicy in Europe. Europeans fear spice and thus all spicy cuisines are the bastard cousins of the actual food. The wait staff were so nice and truly cared for us. They were really fun and easy to joke with. England was playing the World Cup and it was fun to celebrate with them as the game progressed. The food did have some spice, which was nice, but it was still a pale reflection of Indian food. The flavors were on point too. Honestly, if you like Indian food and want a good place to hang out, this will work well. Even if you are not a fan of spice. Give it a go.

_UzDKLDZKO7wbDK_lK9bBA.text: Great chicken Balti and lemon rice. Convenient location. Good price. Great service. When they ask about spice level take their word for it.

VdEi7Uav0B6hvvCr65ZGcw.text: My husband and I had the Taste of India platter and it was delicious! The flavors were wonderful. The food was perfectly spicy. And don't forget to order some garlic naan! Amazing! Thanks Raj!

_RWbUHFAhWsmDd1uxugGog.text: Great place for a hearty meal, you won't leave hungry! We had chicken tikka masala, Garlic Gnaan, King Prawns Delight (believe was the name), and Aloo Gobi. All was great, but the Aloo Gobi was especially delightful. We ordered a side, and wish we would have ordered it as a main course. Some of the reviews on here tend to bash the service, but our experience was not a poor one. They were polite, and at the end of the meal brought us complimentary drinks to try. Overall would recommend, and the service was attentive despite the fact that they were very busy with a dinner rush. Reservations recommended if you are heading there during prime dinner time 6-8!

rhrtJL8clQ-EBq31e1aB6g.text: Taste of India was very good. The portions were large, the service was attentive . They end the  meal with a nice glass of limoncello, and it's a very nice dining experience

Uonvo4lqgq8sPeMfs6YIHw.text: Worse experience. At 2:00pm when we visited the restaurant there was pretty empty and only I table occupied. The server insist us to sit at the corner with no elbow room. When asked to sit at the middle seat, we were told that if we don't take that seat, nobody WILL. Never experienced any server with His kind of altitude anywhere in the world. We are of well dressed and well manner customers.

re7jt2OUEHnrsLAcbxfI4w.text: Abdul was a great waiter. Friendly and funny. He gave us limoncello shots at the end and took our picture too. Service was quick and the food was good!

yIKFB8qkoccCcAHJzWCpQA.text: This place is great. I had the king prawns and have been to a few Indian places in London, but this was the best ones I've been to. I'll definitely tell my friends who come to London and come back next time I'm in the area

A8rzrURJDIuc6Bf7fECVzA.text: Delicious food, the butter chicken was creamy and sweet! We also enjoyed the saag paneer.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom

SpM9ZGxHkhSGckDwL5Zh5g.text: Food was excellent--ordered a lamb curry and and eggplant dish and thoroughly enjoyed both. It also seemed dairy popular with the locals, always a good sign. However ambience was a bit lacking. It felt mostly like any other Indian restaurant I've been to in any other city.

9NKt0hTk6Lf4DsFPSJHWoA.text: Just had dinner at Taste Of India with family. Ordered the Lamb Karahi, Saag Aloo and Butter Chicken with rice and ma'am. Delicious food and our server Ali was very friendly. Would definitely recommend this place.

2Pp6W-ja2MIfR12UqGABsA.text: Trust me on this one!! Steamed muscles in coconut cream sauce. And after that,  taste anything and  everything on the menu. You will find hand crafted, wonderful flavors that transport you across the oceans to the roots of deliciousness. Simply elegant seating  with an eclectic serving of local  diners who know great food.

-J9QHmYG2ZlbTitpadNz2A.text: Some friends and I stopped here after disembarking at Paddington Station, and we enjoyed our meal greatly. The curries were sweeter and not at all spicy compared with other Indian restaurants I've tried, but very tasty nonetheless. Would return!

MhwrwMZJS4M5JS3TIfJurA.text: This was the most pleasant surprise of my trip to London. I'm from Los Angeles, where we have plenty of Indian food but nothing was this good. The food was amazing, every single dish was great. The service was great, everyone was so welcoming. They even gave us great advice on where to visit in London. Plus they were so hospitable that they treated us with an awesome free dessert on the house! Would strongly recommend 10/10.

nZ_Fg0IYt-yyzQC_yCcNlg.text: Food was good had a 50gpb meal. Left my money clip with 150 gbp on my chair by mistake & came back less than 8 min to the table cleaned up, wait staff no interested in helping, and of course no cash in sight. At least it wasn't my passport. Enjoy the fat tip.

X3YmhweIzol8N3ESFTbBmg.text: We just had a great dinner at Taste of India. The staff was friendly, the food was delicious (especially  the chicken tikka masala and saag), and it was just a few minutes from our hotel. Definitely recommend if you are in the area!

NYjoywBOBdmBUy6CQasTbQ.text: Ok food. But I expected more. To be honest I didn't try any other Indian food in London, but Indian food in East coast US was tastier.

Afiu9kqsUDop61ljDGg45g.text: After trying numerous Indian restaurants in the London area, this one takes top prize. The service is exceptional which is often lacking in the London area. While traveling, we were lucky enough To find this place! After trying the food here, we enjoyed multiple meals at this establishment during our recent stay. There is nothing bad on the menu, and if you prefer a particular spice level, the staff will accommodate your request. This is a must try restaurant!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Saag Daal, Chicken tikka Marsala, lamb tikka jalfrezi, and garlic naan - all delicious!

hf0K8YF0vI9e-G2W6tlAQw.text: After reading reviews of Indian restaurants in the area, I was very excited to try Taste of India as our first bit of Indian food in London...I was sorely disappointed. The Butter Chicken was unfortunately flavorless. Being listed as a chef's special, I thought it was a safe choice...how can you mess up butter chicken??? I will say that they have decent prices and from the looks of things their lunch special is quite a deal. I would add that the wait staff are not the most accommodating and leave customers confused and frustrated. While I think they try, it is not something that comes naturally to them.

mscb0aEgCZwms2X4NqgZqg.text: Loved the butter chicken and Lamb balti. Just the right mix is light and spice between the two dishes.

g2M7b-T4eCkhkmKZQzITHQ.text: I started with Seekh Kabab which was actually milder than I'm used to but very good.  I then had chicken tikka masala with rice and naan.  The naan was delicious and very fluffy.  The Tikka masala was creamy.  The space is small but the service is excellent. I was not aware that entrees did not come with rice and correcting that error on my part was prompt and friendly.  If you are in the area as a tourist this is a very nice place to stop for lunch or dinner.

vjYvMEHfggMyJ6mxWV12Sw.text: Excellent food.  Easily five star food.However the service is super slow depending on which waiter you get I'm twiddling my thumbs here waiting to pay and people who got here after us and were served by other waiters have left.  C'mon folks.  I have stuff to do.

irWx-fbqgGAVPEqmQlzuhg.text: First time here coming from Hawai'i and the food was amazing! I normally don't like Indian food but my taste buds have shifted and I had an amazing meal! Raj was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom

_-R6ZpnozjZFhKaChDxalg.text: We stayed in London for about a week and this is by far one of the best meals I had there.  Of course we didn't discover it until our last day in London, but that's usually how things work out.  Service was great and very helpful for anyone new to Indian food.  I'm new to it myself so I can critique it too much, but I got the chicken tikka masala and the chicken was very moist and the sauce had great flavor.  We also got an order of the garlic naan which was awesome.  I was pretty full towards the end of my meal, but there's no way I would have let the naan go to waste...or really any of the food.  I think I ate every crumb and came close to just drinking the sauce right out of the bowl.  Highly recommend.  If traveling via the tube its by Bayswater.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken tikka masala

wNb5iiZl7MLDDO5PZseMWA.text: We found Taste of India one evening while wandering down Queensway after dinner elsewhere. The place was packed, and so we decided to come here for lunch the next day. The Yelp reviews also helped!The place was dead at around 3:00 pm in the afternoon. Our server was also the host, and we got to sit wherever. The place is a little cozy (good thing for us we were the only customers there at the time!).We got the lunch special, which is an appetizer and entree (with rice) for about 12£ (I forget the actual price). The food was good, and portions decent for the price. I got the vegetable samosa, which was different than those I have had in the USA (the samosa wrapper was thin/flakey and not as doughy). I ordered the lentils with chicken. My partner got a lamb dish, but they switched the meats (so I got his lamb but with my lentils). We also got an order of naan to share.Definitely worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Lamb with lentils
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken dish
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Naan

_2gsamPa69C7BrbaG4uGLw.text: Hankering for some Indian food and this was the best bet in the area. Late Monday night and thankfully this spot had room available and the kitchen was still open.Lots of familiar options on the menu, yet opted for something different. Ordered the Butter Chicken Curry (£9.50), Paratha (£3), and a Cobra Beer (£4.25). Beer comes out first, a very light lager that's not really good on its own; much better paired with food. Chicken and bread come out next - a creamy gravy with large chunks of boneless chicken swimming inside. Chicken is cooked well but the gravy had a grainy texture that I didn't care for. Paratha helped matters, despite the fact it resembled more of a roti.Service here is quick as they're efficient with the limited space they have. Didn't like the fact that the curry dish doesn't come with rice, so maybe better value in other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Butter chicken and paratha
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Beer
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Menu

962UPQAANdSk9u4jEyYA4Q.text: We were just wandering around Queensway looking for someplace for dinner and I saw Indian and decided that's what I wanted. So pleased with my choice as it was definitely a great one! The atmosphere was warm and inviting and we were greeted promptly and courteously by the staff. Our food - butter chicken, chicken rogan josh, and of course naan - was delicious. Very fresh and flavorful. And have to say Ali (and all the staff) were great. We are just visiting for the week, but plan to go back before our weeklong trip is over, and hope to return in future visits. Thanks!

gFhgWstQ7q25h2n7jrZq5Q.text: This place was disappointing. We had eaten at a different Indian restaurant, and that place was so good. We were expecting this place to be good as well, especially since we were in London. The dishes were all just very watered down versions of what they could be. You can even tell by the pictures that the sauces had hardly any weight or body to them.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tikka Masala
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Rogon Josh
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Butter Masala I believe

a_ydTi-a80KOCmsQQpxV8A.text: Taste of India totally changed my perception of Indian Cuisine. My three prior experience were all in the U.S. and with friends who claimed to be "experts" on Indian Foods. All three were terrible and kept me away from Indian Food for ten years. Visiting London for the first time everyone who had been here told us the Indian Restaurants were excellent. So with great trepidation we found ourselves in Taste of India. We were greeted warmly at the door and led to our table. We were seated next to a party of four. As we were perusing our menus the waiter was bringing a plethora of food to the four top next to us. It all looked so good, I asked the waiter what they had ordered. He told us that it was the sampling menu for four. The server a very nice gentleman named Ali suggested the same option for two. We took Ali's suggestion and the meal that followed was excellent. Ali did an expert job of describing each dish and how it was prepared. His service was impeccable. The prices were very reasonable about 43 pounds. We plan on making this our last stop before heading back home

D22LnI7UMY9eoqyLYASZ8A.text: Indian food at an affordable price and with amazing hospitality, come to this place where you'll meet Raj and he will make your Indian food cravings come true. 4 hungry adults with a child, Raj and his staff made us feel right at home with delicious Indian food, Chicken Marsala, Naan, Rice, yummy spicy chickpeas..4 person dinner! Yum yum.. and afterwards limoncello shot..yep come here!

x0Q1lyZvhCjsNwBqar6Lqg.text: This Indian food is absolutely amazing and another reason why I won't eat British food when I'm in London.... The Indian food in London is just too damn good!  My colleague and I walked into this beautifully for Indian restaurant who is seated at mediately by a waiter name Raj. We started our course with poppadom's, then went for a chicken tikka appetizier and some curry.  The food was amazing but be careful when they say the curry is hot, they mean it!!!! We wanted to split a Lassie at the very end and Raj was very happy to accommodate.  Overall and amazing experience and another reason why I will not eat British food when I'm in great Britain

2mAa1Pd8F8f725gA935n7A.text: Wonderful dinner. The chicken tikka masala was really good, and the tandoori grill plate was excellent. Best part - our waiter Raj was the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom

mmaPCQPW0OO63w3SRWq40w.text: This was really an unfortunate choice - the food wasn't fresh or delicious or even warm on the inside.  If you love Indian food - go someplace else.

TCqYPuQc0ABR8yzcAjDWWg.text: Ok so I've eaten lots of Indian food... let me tell you... this place was excellent. Ok prepare for a bit of a wait, but WELL worth it!!! Ordered sagg peneer (sp?), tiki masala along with the rice, naan and other veggies dishes. I would go back if i lived in London.

Zr4zAWcIYlpMLo7nmPRC_g.text: Great place for take away.  My wife and I ordered to here while on a vacation to London.

I0X9YQUpaMO2okCMxvC29w.text: Conveniently located and just a short walk from either the Queensway or Bayswater Tube stations, this place is a gem. We looked it up on Yelp and decided to stick around the Central Line if possible. So glad we did!We easily got a table around 8pm on a rainy Monday night. The service was very attentive without being overbearing, but it's the food that will bring us back next time we visit London. The curries are complex and layered with flavor and each had a low, slow burn that built as we ate. The meat was so tender we had trouble keeping it on a fork. My wine was a generous pour, too.You can get tasty Indian food all over London for any amount of money you wish to spend, but this is the spot to get the real thing at a decent price. Go if you can.

qmjwcCJHVBXQB9eIORQbuw.text: The food was delicious!!! Very authentic.  Excellent customer service by Raj and staff!!  Definitely have to come back here!!!

Lxru6dJ6v-woIbqC3p1pXw.text: The restaurant is rather cramped but that's not a big issue. The service was prompt and good. The price is rather good but the portion sizes aren't particularly large. The food itself is average. The onion bhajis were good but slightly floury. The rice was okay, the naan tasty but very oily and the chicken tikka was boring - could have been a ready meal from Tesco. The chicken was a bit chewy as well. Overall, a distinctly average Indian restaurant.

KlWI-TjbjZb60_t0a8UyjA.text: Good indian food - a little underwhelming but always could be because I ordered the basic chicken tikka masala. Great ambience and seems very authentic! Great update: they take credit cards!!

6mN-usDcydq7IPEovysJew.text: We were looking for a place with tasty Indian food at ok prices. Helped this place and walked in to a tastefully decorated dining area. There was a table of six sitting and eating and NO ONE else. We should be taken the hint that it was lunch time and the place was empty. We ordered samosas and at the price of 5 pounds they were so not worth it. Two tiny little bites. The rest of the meal did not get better with tasteless dishes that were suppose yo be spicy. The waiter was friendly but out to make a buck. Tea five pounds, he was going to charge us another four pounds when I asked for chili sauce to flavor the food and ten minutes later( while my food got cold) he came out with a dish of sauce. I told him I didn't ask for that and he said," no charge ". Sixty pounds later we were still hungry and upset we even stepped into this place. So sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken masala bland
Photo of Taste of India - London, United Kingdom. Tiny samosas
